brown: Brown is the normal colour and shows bile pigment is doing its job.
green: Green stool is usually from leafy veggies or faster gut transit.
yellow: Yellow can mean extra fat or malabsorption after greasy meals.
red: Red may be beetroot… or fresh blood. Seek help if uncertain.
black: Black could be iron tablets or digested blood – check your meds.
pale: Clay-coloured stool suggests little bile; see a doctor if persistent.
